messages.title: Only Labour can beat the Tories in Devizes
messages.content: In 2017 Labour came second with double the vote of the Lib Dems. We can win and we will put people before profit and privilege.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Committed to eliminating homelessness and rough sleeping.
Wants to reverse funding cuts, making sure there are well-staffed schools and safe places for children to play. Concerned about cuts to county's youth services and early childhood education.
Opposes further closure of libraries due to spending cuts.
References to projects cancelled due to economic restrictions and the negative impact on jobs.
Community action on climate change is mentioned.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour is presented as the only alternative to the Tories, having come second in the previous election.

issues.brexitEurope: Mentions a hard Brexit and the Tory party candidate's support for it.
issues.economy: References to projects cancelled and impact on jobs.
issues.education: Discussion about cuts to youth services and early childhood education, and the impact on schools.
issues.environment: Community action on climate change noted.

leaflet.personalStatement: Rachael Schneider Ross lives locally, knows the area and the issues, and has been campaigning for change in Devizes, Marlborough, Tidworth and across the constituency with your Labour Team.

politicalExperience.achievements: She has challenged the Conservative domination of Wiltshire Council in a recent declaration of climatic emergency.

images.caption: Labour Party members bringing our message to the public.
Campaigning at County Hall to save Oxenwood and Braeside.
